title: Which brand of accordions is good for starters? My aim is to play jazz, polkas, and to adapt violin music with it. - Quora

response.answer_text: Hohner (German) makes a range of affordable, acceptable accordions that beginners will do fine with. If you get to a higher level, where you want a finer instrument, look at Italian-made instruments. The cheapest lines are Chinese-made, but you do get what you pay for.

Brand isn;t relevant. You have to decide piano or chromatic button (less common in USA). Then how much to spend. You could go Chinese for $500 or so. Or Euro for $2000+. Or used (piano accordions can be had for $40 if you wait long enough and know what the pitfalls are. Chromatic button accs are very rare… ). Or you could go electronic/computer/MIDI (Roland).
